sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The LFS-Bootscripts package contains the system bootscripts.

sect3.title: checkfs
sect3.para: The checkfs script checks the file systems just before they are mounted (with the exception of journal and network based file systems)

sect3.title: cleanfs
sect3.para: The cleanfs script removes files that shouldn't be preserved between reboots, such as /var/run/*, /var/lock/*, it re-creates /var/run/utmp and removes the possible present /etc/nologin, /fastboot and /forcefsck files.

sect3.title: functions
sect3.para: The functions script contains shared functions among different scripts such as error checking, status checking, etc.

sect3.title: halt
sect3.para: The halt script halts the system.

sect3.title: loadkeys
sect3.para: The loadkeys script loads the proper keymap table that matches your keyboard layout.

sect3.title: localnet
sect3.para: The localnet script sets up the system's hostname and local loopback device.

sect3.title: mountfs
sect3.para: The mountfs script mounts all file systems that aren't marked noauto or aren't network based.

sect3.title: network
sect3.para: The network script setup network interfaces (such as network cards) and sets up the default gateway where applicable.

sect3.title: rc
sect3.para: The rc script is the master runlevel control script which is responsible for running all the other scripts one-by-one in a specific sequence.

sect3.title: reboot
sect3.para: The reboot scripts reboots the system.

sect3.title: sendsignals
sect3.para: The sendsignals script makes sure every process is terminated before the system reboots or halts.

sect3.title: setclock
sect3.para: The setclock scripts resets the kernel clock to localtime in case the hardware clock isn't set to GMT time.

sect3.title: swap
sect3.para: The swap scripts enables and disables swap files and partitions.

sect3.title: sysklogd
sect3.para: The sysklogd script start and stops the system and kernel log daemons.

sect3.title: template
sect3.para: The template script is a template you can use to create your own bootscripts for your other daemons.
